greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if prime(k)^(k+1) divides n for some k, otherwise 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
mathematica: Table[Boole[Count[Prime[#]^(# + 1) & /@ Range[PrimePi@ Floor[Sqrt[n]]], _?(Mod[n, #] == 0 &)] > 0], {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 11 2021 *)
program: (PARI) A342024(n) = if(1==n,0,my(f = factor(n)); for(k=1, #f~, if(f[k, 2]>primepi(f[k, 1]), return(1))); (0));
xref: Differs from A129251 and A276077 for the first time at n=108, as here a(108) = 1.
Differs from A342023 for the first time at n=625, where a(625)=1, while A342023(625)=0.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 09 2021
